Package im.moonshot.curta.parser

Contains classes for parsing and executing the calculator. The parser and analyzers fail fast, that is if any errors are encountered then execution is immediately stopped.

The parser implements the EBNF grammar below. For grammar validation https://planetcalc.com/5600/ is a useful resource. 


     function            = arithmetic_function | let_function
     arithmetic_function = ("add" | "sub" | "mult" | "div") "(" expression "," expression ")"
     let_function        = "let" "(" variable "," value_expression "," function ")"
     expression          = number | variable | function
     value_expression    = number | function
     variable            = #'[A-Za-z]+'
     number              = ["-"] #'[0-9]+'

While the grammar does not define whitespace, the parser itself is whitespace insensitive and ignores any whitespace encountered.

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CalculatingInterpreter
    Interprets the abstract syntax table and executes the calculations.
    FunctionTree
    Abstract class for nodes representing a function in an abstract syntax tree.
    GraphvizInterpreter
    An interpreter that outputs a graphviz visualization of the abstract syntax tree.
    Parser
    A recursive descent parser.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    SemanticException
    Indicates a semantic error occurred while visiting the abstract syntax tree.
